events.target_title: Scrollbar does not update since 3.20

note.body:
I am seeing this bug with GTK 3.24.10 in my application programs.

The symptoms are as follows.  The scrollbar is drawn with the correct size and initial position.  Clicking and dragging on the slider sends the value_changed signal to the application.  The application scrolls its drawing area correctly.  However, the slider does not move.  Clicking on the slider a second time resets the scroll value to the now-erroneous initial position and the bug re-occurs.

Also, the application program is unable to move the slider by calling gtk_adjustment_set_value.  The slider will remain stuck for as long as the scrollbar is in the buggy state.

The buggy state can be exited by resizing the application window.  Afterwards, the slider moves properly.  Other actions may also cause the scrollbar to exit the buggy state.  However, if the application hides and later shows the scrollbars (to reflect contents being deleted and inserted), the buggy state is re-entered.

The application has a GtkTable containing a GtkDrawingArea, GtkHScrollbar, GtkVScrollbar, and GtkLabel.  The last three have the no_show_all property set.  The drawing area is always shown; the scrollbars are shown and hidden as needed; and the empty label is never shown.

The drawing area's configure event handler sets both scrollbars' page sizes via gtk_adjustment_set_page_size and calls gtk_widget_show or gtk_widget_hide to show or to hide the scrollbars as needed.  Because the presence of the scrollbars affects the size of the drawing area, the drawing area's configure event handler may be invoked an additional one or two times to settle on the final size.

For the scrollbars to enter the buggy state, it is necessary for the drawing area's content to be sized so that both the horizontal and vertical scrollbars go from hidden to shown.  I am guessing that GTK3's logic cannot handle the sequence of events generated by *two* resize requests.  The bug does not occur if I modify the application to always show both scrollbars, or size the drawing area's content so that only one scrollbar needs to be shown.

In the cases in which the bug occurs, it is 100% repeatable.

This bug is specific to the GTK3 builds.  The same applications work perfectly when built with GTK 2.24.32.
Ed

events.target_title: Scrollbar does not update since 3.20

note.body:
The GTK3 documentation says:

"If a GtkScrolledWindow doesn’t behave quite as you would like, or doesn’t have exactly the right layout, it’s very possible to set up your own scrolling with GtkScrollbar and for example a GtkGrid."

I believe the code is legal.  It has been working on GTK2 for years and is not small.
Ed

events.target_title: Scrollbar does not update since 3.20

note.body:
I tried converting one application to GtkScrolledWindow as a test case.  I found that GtkScrolledWindow was not a suitable replacement because it does not comprehend the application's drawing handler doing its own scrolling, and scrolling may not be in units of pixels.

The successful solution was to delay updates to the scrollbar's page size and visibility from the drawing area's configure event handler to an idle handler.  This enabled the original GtkTable code to work without generating the sequence of events that broke GTK3.  The workaround does not implement minor corner cases (clamping), but they are much less problematic than the scrollbars getting stuck.

The original code was far from accidental - it got all functionality right on GTK2 because scrolling was designed to be done that way.  GTK3's inability to run the same code is a bug.

I am sensing that this bug will be resolved by changing the documentation to specify how custom scrolling needs to be done.

Thanks for the replies!
Ed

Proposal: Monthly "what's happening in GNOME" posts

note.body:
I agree with @BrainBlasted. \
I want to point to another FOSS project and try to analyse and get inspiration from what they do right.

Here is how Blender organizes stuff:

* [Blender Community](https://blender.community/), where on the left sidebar:
  * Blender.Today 
    * there is a livestream (hosted on youtube) every week presenting development progress and answering user questions/feedback
      * the livestream is **not** hosted by a developer, although they sometimes go on as guests
      * one of the focuses is to highlight and encourage community participation and contributions to the project
      * [example](https://blender.community/c/today/rpdbbc/)
  * Right-Click Select => Community proposals/feature requests - discussions and voting
  * GraphicAll => experimental builds of master and different branches provided by the community and/or developers who feel like it
  * Other communities (by language etc)
  * Blender chat => irc replacement?
  
* [Blender Developers Blog](https://code.blender.org/) -> centralized place for all blog posts

* [Blender DevTalk](https://devtalk.blender.org/) => discourse instance
  * there is a simple weekly post with developers reports on their activities during the previous week 
  * [example](https://devtalk.blender.org/t/26-august-2019/9051)
  
* [Blender Wiki](https://wiki.blender.org/)

* [Blender Development](https://developer.blender.org/) => Phabricator instance

(there is also developer mailing lists, etc)

I've reported this issue on the libheif github, waiting to hear from the author: https://github.com/strukturag/libheif/issues/150

The comments in `heif_limits.h` say `// Artificial limit to avoid allocating too much memory.` so most likely this can be increased with no ill effect. This limit is not used when encoding, only when decoding, and leads to saved images being unopenable.

events.target_title: e2fsck has unsuported feature: metadata_csum
secret_password_lookup_sync doesn't ask to unlock

note.body:
Looks like the problem is inside gnome-keyring.

In short: Creating schema with `SECRET_SCHEMA_DONT_MATCH_NAME` flag helps.

When you create schema without that flag schema name is sent as attribute to match (`xdg:schema`).
On gnome-keyring side that is compared to attributes of a secret-item, but looks like locked item have extra schema attribute.

I'll demonstrate that on IntelliJ Idea's data sources:

This does not yield any result:
```
$ secret-tool search --all service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e"  xdg:schema "com.intellij.credentialStore.Credential"
```
Without schema name:
```
$ secret-tool search --all service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e"               
[/org/freedesktop/secrets/collection/Default_5fkeyring/294]
label = 
secret = 
created = 
modified = 
schema = org.freedesktop.Secret.Generic
attribute.gkr:compat:hashed:xdg:schema = b7f803914e140273f23c159cb786cc2f
attribute.gkr:compat:hashed:service = fc78e98170e2cf65607467506fb424a8
```
See two schema names: one hashed and one not.

`secret_password_lookup_sync` is almost equivalent to `secret-tool lookup`. Let's call it.

That does nothing:
```
$ secret-tool lookup service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e" xdg:schema "com.intellij.credentialStore.Credential
```
That prompts password:
```
$ secret-tool lookup service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e"
```
And this:
```
$ secret-tool lookup service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e"  xdg:schema "org.freedesktop.Secret.Generic"
```
After unlock everything goes upside down:

No result for:
```
$ secret-tool search --all service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e"  xdg:schema "org.freedesktop.Secret.Generic"
```
And success for:
```
$ secret-tool search --all service "IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e"  xdg:schema "com.intellij.credentialStore.Credential"
[/org/freedesktop/secrets/collection/Default_5fkeyring/294]
label = IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e
secret = ***
created = 2019-08-30 12:09:04
modified = 2019-08-30 12:09:04
schema = com.intellij.credentialStore.Credential
attribute.service = IntelliJ Platform DB — f17f7352-a8ad-4eeb-b292-4a252c8ddf1e
```

Hope that'll help to fix the issue.

UPD:
Looks like caused by:
```
	schema_name = g_hash_table_lookup (info->attributes, GKM_SECRET_FIELD_SCHEMA);
	if (schema_name == NULL)
		schema_name = gkm_secret_compat_format_item_type (info->type);
	gkm_secret_item_set_schema (item, schema_name);
```
in `gnome-keyring/pkcs11/secret-store/gkm-secret-binary.c` & `gnome-keyring/pkcs11/secret-store/gkm-secret-textual.c`

note.body: Yes, I intend on reusing the scripts that ship with upstream GEGL. Although my main expertise lie with CMake, I guess it's high time to learn the ways of Meson. :)

events.target_title: Babl.gir not picked up correctly
Babl.gir not picked up correctly

note.body:
@ok Thank you, that did help. I did add `<home>/.local/share` and GEGL built fine. I went on to trying to build GIMP to use my development branch of GEGL, and I succeeded, but the build is very hacky and here's why.

Using `XDG_DATA_DIRS` to get the build going shuts up `g-ir-scanner`, but then breaks this asset compilation as [described here](https://www.wiki.gimp.org/wiki/Hacking:Problems_and_solutions#Build_of_GIMP_master_fails_in_gimpcursor.c). Therefore I set the variable up until `g-ir-scanner` is done, wait for the error to trigger, delete the env var and finish the build.

Is there a better way to do it?

Note: the actual error message is:
```
Couldn't find include 'Gegl-0.4.gir' (search path: '['./.', '../.', 'gir-1.0', '/usr/share/gir-1.0', '/usr/share/gir-1.0', '/usr/share/gir-1.0']')
```
Going by the meaning of this env var I found [here](https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/0.6/ar01s03.html) it doesn't matter if I only set my custom path to the girs or if I append or prepend it to the system default list.

events.target_title: Windows CI/CD

note.body:
Just to report on progress: the blocking issue of getting a Windows build is being able to consume either Conan or Vcpkg packages via Meson. The dependency graph of GEGL is not negligable and does require some depenendency management.

Vcpkg -> Meson interop issues: [Vcpkg](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/issues/6683) and [Meson](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/mesonbuild/OEB0UIlLl0A) sides. My take is that Meson and CMake need an updated mechanism to talk to each other, than the currently used (and deprecated) [--find-package mode](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.15/manual/cmake.1.html#run-the-find-package-tool) of CMake used and described by Meson [here](https://github.com/mesonbuild/meson/blob/7b9c348102792030859ed0001a51416506a0a092/mesonbuild/dependencies/base.py#L1268-L1273).

Windows CI/CD descriptions should not be more than a git clone of vcpkg, bootstrapping it and invoking a `vcpkg install whole bonch of deps`.

events.target_title: Option to set color space of alpha channels and layer masks
Layer masks do not seem to support full 0-255 grayscale range

note.body:
I was researching the problem of color space transformations in GIMP. I have written extended explanation and proposed solution for this problem in issue #3887.

The fact that masks use linear precision is part of this problem, but it is not the core of the problem. The core problem is in color space of the alpha channel because even if the mask channel was in sRGB space, it would still need to be transformed into linear space when it is transformed into alpha. So it is a good thing that the mask uses the same color space as the alpha channel.

The solution I suggested in #3887 would be to have an option to choose color space for both the alpha channel and the layer mask.

events.target_title: Change render preset doesn't change file name extension
Support scrollTo, scrollToPoint, scrollSubstringTo, scrollSubstringToPoint

note.body:
Assuming that this implementation must follow the [IAccessible2 API](https://accessibility.linuxfoundation.org/a11yspecs/ia2/docs/html/_i_a2_common_types_8idl.html) I have the following questions:

- Should we accept strings where End < Start and just swap the parameters?
- Is the 'top left' of a string the top left of the first character, the bottom left of the first character or the top left of the rectangle containing the whole string?  In the last case the first character might not be visible after scrolling.
- In scrollSubstringToPoint() should 'top left' be interpreted as 'top right' for Right-to-Left scripts?
- IA2_SCROLL_TYPE_ANYWHERE is defined as "as much as possible of the substring within the window", should that be strictly respected even if the beginning of the string isn't within the window?

events.target_title: Support scrollTo, scrollToPoint, scrollSubstringTo, scrollSubstringToPoint

note.body:
I'd like to understand what to do when the substring contained between the two offsets doesn't fit in the rectangle defined by the same offset. In that case the top left of the rectangle might be different from `start_offset` and `end_offset`.

So my question is: is there an easy way to extract that rectangle?

events.target_title: Support scrollTo, scrollToPoint, scrollSubstringTo, scrollSubstringToPoint

note.body:
Attached is a simple implementation based on gtk_text_view_scroll_to_iter().  It should be good enough for the general use case of passing words to the API.  Some comments on the implementation:

* scrollSubstringToPoint() only consider `start_offset`.  Meaning that the position of the character at this offset will be placed at (x, y) inside the window.

* scrollSubStringTo() let gtk_text_view_scroll_to_iter() what to do for the ATK_SCROLL_ANYWHERE case.

* I followed getText() and decided to return `FALSE` when `end_offset` is smaller than `start_offset`.

I'm open to any comment.  I believe this implementation is good enough to be committed and can then be improved based on the upcoming use cases.

[0001-Implement-ATK-s-scrollSubstringTo-and-scrollSubstrin.patch](/uploads/f50e662e213141b514a8f6a6f9fab0e1/0001-Implement-ATK-s-scrollSubstringTo-and-scrollSubstrin.patch)

note.body:
I would like to respectfully contribute my support for the perspective that having a way to disable this would be very useful. I would also point out that for every person contributing "me too" to the discussion, there are probably dozens or hundreds or more people who feel the same way but don't know how or are not motivated to seek support. Additionally, in my searching I have not found anybody defending this behavior as critical or important or expected or intuitive. I just see people saying, "Can we change it?" or "I have changed it; please accept my patch" and "There is no good reason to change it" or "Nobody really wants this".

I personally find window-to-window snapping extremely frustrating in every situation. I never want it to happen. (Edge snapping is cool, though.) As a daily GNOME 3 for the last 2-4 years (not sure :sweat_smile:), this behavior frustrates me dozens of times a day. It's also disappointing that this behavior is absent or at least can be disabled in every desktop environment I have used except my favorite one. I mean, I really hate window-to-window snapping :crying_cat_face:, but I also really love GNOME. :heart: 

I would really appreciate it if there were any way at all to disable this behavior. Being a software engineer, I do appreciate that every line of code has a permanent associated maintenance cost. My humble opinion is that this is a worthwhile change. Please accept @chrisjbillington's contribution.

I don't need a direct response. I just want to raise my hand and say "me too". Thank you, everybody, for your time and for continuing the discussion, and thank you @chrisjbillington for your time and effort.

*Edit: I initially said I'd been using GNOME 3 daily since Ubuntu 18.04, but then remembered I was off Ubuntu for a while because I didn't like Unity or their GNOME config, so I changed it to 2-4 years which is my best guess.*

events.target_title: Create archive dialog should allow writing the compressed archive to another directory

note.body:
>  It would be simple for some people, not for others. Writing paths is not something we should expect people to do.

It doesn't need to change anything in UI, if done without File Chooser.

A user is asked for a filename, one inputs "foobar" and it goes as before. Internally $dirname = "" and $basename = "foobar". The archive file is written as before to the directory where files to be included are.

Or one inputs "/tmp/tars/foobar", and $dirname = "/tmp/tars" and $basename = "foobar". Now chdir first to /tmp/tars if it exists. If not, report error and/or optionally could create all the needed missing subdirectories and then write foobar.suffix there.

>  Yes, we can only know after we try, and then, if it fails, it could be nice to offer an alternative.

A logic and code to offer an alternative seems more complex already, and the above simple feature could be included in the first try already then anyway; support for $dirname and $basename for the filename of the archive file.

events.target_title: Crash when removing screen while suspended

note.body:
Just in case, here is my workaround for dealing with these issues (I'm using Gnome 3 on X11 with Fedora 30, my machine is Dell Latitude 5480):

1) Before suspending, run this script to disable all external monitors

```
#!/bin/bash

for i in `seq 1 3`; do
    xrandr --output HDMI-"$i" --off
    xrandr --output DP-"$i" --off
    for j in `seq 1 3`; do
        xrandr --output DP-"$i"-"$j" --off
    done
done
```

2) Open the laptop lid, so that the internal screen is properly initialized and suspend the laptop.

Not very convenient, I agree, but it at least you can resume from suspend and continue your work without
fearing that Gnome crashed and all open windows have been lost.

events.target_title: Poor rendering from evince (with specific cairo library version)
Poor rendering from evince (with specific cairo library version)

note.body:
If some other arch/manjaro users hit this bug, here is a short summary:
- the issue is caused by the cairo library (c.f. the corresponding [issue in their tracker](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/cairo/cairo/issues/376) )
- a workaround is to revert the package `cairo` to `1.16.0-2` (e.g. using [Arch Linux Archive](https://archive.archlinux.org/packages/c/cairo/))

I currently don't have time for trying to fix cairo, but if someone want to take a look, the (probably) faulty commit is identified in the Cairo issue.

events.target_title: Poor rendering from evince (with specific cairo library version)

note.body:
As mentioned in [my last comment](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/evince/issues/1244#note_607299), the workaround is to revert `cairo`.
While LaTeX/beamer documents tend to trigger this bug a lot, it is not related to that nor to evince itself.

As I am not involved in these projects and currently have very few time available, the best you can do is to check the [cairo issue](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/cairo/cairo/issues/376).
If you have the technical skills to inspect the bug, you can propose a patch.
Otherwise, we have to wait and to ask our distribution package managers (Archlinux) to revert to the older cairo version...

note.body:
I'm using Nautilus 3.32.1-stable on Ubuntu 19.04 using Wayland, and I'm having this issue as well.

Once a file or folder is selected via the touchscreen, it becomes impossible to select another file/folder via the mouse or touchscreen. The user can still scroll through files, using the scroll wheel or touchscreen, and mousing over files temporarily highlights them as normal. But files can only be selected and opened via the keyboard.

The bug is tied to the tab where the initial tap happened. If the user opens another window, or another tab within the bugged window, the new tab works fine, until the bug is triggered again.

I like to read documents in my laptop's tablet mode, and this bug makes that difficult.

events.target_title: Camel: Correct result of the "is" filter condition on address headers

note.body:
> but I'd be afraid of the 'is', because, in case of To and Cc headers, it decodes each address in respective header and compare that decoded address separately. That means that if your address is in the 'To' together with other recipients, then it'll match as well.

This is exactly what happens: My address and some other address(es) are in 'To' and my filter matches.

What I want to achieve is I want to mark e-mails where I am the sole 'To' recipient. I don't really care about the contents of 'Cc' or 'Bcc' (i.e. they might be empty/missing or have other recipients). I want the filter to match if my address is in 'To' exclusively. As soon as there is any other e-mail address besides mine in 'To' I don't want the filter to match.

Given the fact that there is also a 'contains' condition for recipient lists, I would have expected that 'contains' has the effect that I am now experiencing with 'is'. My assumption was that 'is' is an exclusive check and 'contains' is inclusive of other recipients in the same header.

If my assumption (and the assumption of the question I found on superuser.com) is wrong, then this would turn into a feature request for a new condition rather than being a bug report.

events.target_title: Camel: Correct result of the "is" filter condition on address headers

note.body:
Thanks for the hint regarding "Recipients" including both 'To' and 'Cc'. Will use the 'Specific header' 'To' approach that you are sugggesting as soon as the issue is resolved.

I'm still not convinced that the meaning of 'is' as it is now should be changed, or if there should be an entirely new condition like 'is exclusively' or similar.

I actually have a few other filters where I'm matching partial e-mail addresses like '@specific-domain.com' using 'contains' and full e-mail addresses using 'is', and there I don't want 'is' to be 'this is the only recipient'. These filters would break by changing the current meaning of 'is'.

events.target_title: Camel: Correct result of the "is" filter condition on address headers

note.body:
Reposting my last comment from https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/evolution/issues/614:

Thanks for the hint regarding "Recipients" including both 'To' and 'Cc'. Will use the 'Specific header' 'To' approach that you are sugggesting as soon as the issue is resolved.

I'm still not convinced that the meaning of 'is' as it is now should be changed, or if there should be an entirely new condition like 'is exclusively' or similar.

I actually have a few other filters where I'm matching partial e-mail addresses like '@specific-domain.com' using 'contains' and full e-mail addresses using 'is', and there I don't want 'is' to be 'this is the only recipient'. These filters would break by changing the current meaning of 'is'.

*I am personally fine* with changing the meaning of `is`, but I'm a little worried about other peoples' filters suddenly behaving differently.

Most students using our dual boot labs are only there to use Windows and have zero Linux experience. If they come across a strange screen and it's not immediately obvious how to get back to Windows, they will just hard power-off the machine. note.body:
I installed the latest packages and it is still not working, which I think is what you expected since you just added debug?

I do notice the following new debug statements prefixing each message in the logs:
```sh
   ews_connection_utils_maybe_prepare_bearer_auth: cnc:0x55ff170226a0 msg:0x7fee5c0062e0 auth method from source:'Office365'
   ews_connection_utils_maybe_prepare_bearer_auth: cnc:0x55ff170226a0 msg:0x7fee5c0062e0 reusing bearer, success:1 err:'none'
```

This debug does not appear before the "Subscribe" call, which is consistent with the fact the Authorization Bearer header is never populated.

I ended up pulling out the code from the master branch to take a quick peak myself.  What it appears to me is the ews-notification code does not seem to participate in the same paradigm as the rest of the message processing code (that appears to all be in ews-connection, except for this notification code). It seems like all messages in ews-connection all call e_ews_connection_queue_request which seems to at some point call ews_connection_utils_maybe_prepare_bearer_auth which would apparently set the Authorization header.

The notification code seems isolated and it appears that e_ews_notification_start_listening_sync likely gets called to spin up a background thread to do the listening.  The "runnable" function seems to be e_ews_notification_get_events_thread.  I don't see any way that the ews_connection_utils_maybe_prepare_bearer_auth can ever be called from e_ews_notification_get_events_thread.

note.body:
Hello. I had this problem a few months ego when I replaced my disks (1 ssd and one hdd) with one nvme drive. But my symptoms where a bit different: OOM keeps killing tracker-miner-extract so I get complete freezes every ~10 seconds. PC becomes unusable after a while. I somehow disabled tracker-miner back then, after i found no solution. Sadly i don't remember how. But tracker miner started doing the same thing today. I guess it's because it was upgraded to 2.3.0. (So that version actually made things worse for me :sweat_smile: ) ## Data All this data was captured today, in the same environment. ### Specs ``` OS: Arch Linux Kernel: x86_64 Linux 5.2.14-arch1-1-ARCH Uptime: 31m Packages: 1773 Shell: zsh 5.7.1 Resolution: 3840x2160 DE: GNOME WM: GNOME Shell WM Theme: GTK Theme: Adwaita-dark [GTK2/3] Icon Theme: Adwaita Font: Source Sans Pro 11 CPU: Intel Core i7-5820K @ 12x 3.6GHz [45.0°C] GPU: GeForce GTX 980 RAM: 3752MiB / 23942MiB ``` ``` ❯ pacman -Q --info tracker-miners Name : tracker-miners Version : 2.3.0-1 ``` ### OOM Output ``` [ 712.970386] [ 8343] 1000 8343 5655624 5222778 42438656 0 0 tracker-extract [ 712.970387] oom-kill:constraint=CONSTRAINT_NONE,nodemask=(null),cpuset=/,mems_allowed=0,global_oom,task_memcg=/user.slice/user-1000.slice/user@1000.service,task=tracker-extract,pid=8343,uid=1000 [ 712.970439] Out of memory: Killed process 8343 (tracker-extract) total-vm:22622496kB, anon-rss:20891108kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:4kB [ 713.419718] oom_reaper: reaped process 8343 (tracker-extract), now anon-rss:0kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:4kB ``` ### Video of OOM doing its work ![tracker-miner-memory-rage](/uploads/4d5e463df672d2b27f00b5a017bb2c7a/tarcker-miner-memory-rage.webm) ### logs

events.target_title: tracker-extract causes system lock-up due to 100% CPU and memory usage

note.body: Is there any workaround for this? I currently have to immediately run `pkill tracker` after start or my computer basically completely freezes. (OOM somehow only helps if i don't have other processes like chrome open)
